attributes.additional_details: Enforce refunds or other recompense for consumers who have the right not to fly while advice is not to fly and social distancing is still in place. How can you social distance on a plane. Where are out human rights to feel safe? If 300 met in a park and were in close proximity they would be dispersed or arrested so how are airlines allowed to do this?
attributes.background: Help consumers who have lost money with flights that have or are departing when the FCO have advised against all but non essential travel and travel insurance is void. How can the airlines get away with this without offering refunds or a least vouchers

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Require travel companies & airlines to pay compensation if no refund in 14 days: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317878

Create a fund to reimburse money lost due to covid-19 travel: cancellations: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304912

Require airlines cancel flights to places the FCO has advised against travel to: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333773
